DataElement.preferredName: LARS Score 4 V1 Have to Open Bowels Within One Hour of Last Bowel Opening Score 3 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Person's stated response of whether they have ever have to open their bowels again within one hour of the last bowel opening, using a 3 point scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Lower Anterior Resection Syndrome Score Have to Open Bowels Within One Hour of Last Bowel Opening Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A standardized six-item questionnaire developed by Emmertsen et al. in 2012 that utilizes three- and four-point rating scales to assess bowel dysfunction following a low anterior resection for rectal cancer.:A question about whether an individual has or had bowel movements within one hour of their last bowel movement._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A standardized six-item questionnaire developed by Emmertsen et al. in 2012 that utilizes three- and four-point rating scales to assess bowel dysfunction following a low anterior resection for rectal cancer.

Concepts.definition: A standardized five-item questionnaire developed by Emmertsen et al. in 2012 that utilizes three- and four-point rating scales to assess bowel dysfunction following a low anterior resection for rectal cancer.

Property.preferredName: Have to Open Bowels Within One Hour of Last Bowel Opening Score
Property.preferredDefinition: A question about whether an individual has or had bowel movements within one hour of their last bowel movement._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.longName: Have to Open Bowels Within One Hour of Last Bowel Opening
Concepts.definition: A question about whether an individual has or had bowel movements within one hour of their last bowel movement.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

ValueDomain.preferredName: Lower Anterior Resection Syndrome Score Scale
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A standardized six-item questionnaire developed by Emmertsen et al. in 2012 that utilizes three- and four-point rating scales to assess bowel dysfunction following a low anterior resection for rectal cancer._An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not ever; at no time in the past (or future).

Concepts.definition: Not ever; at no time in the past (or future).

PermissibleValues.value: Yes, less than once per week

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Yes Less than Once a Week
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question._An indication that something occurs or occurred less than once a week.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
An indication that something occurs or occurred less than once a week.

PermissibleValues.value: Yes, at least once per week

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Yes At Least Once a Week
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question._Happening at least once during a week.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
Happening at least once during a week.
